short_description: This function trains a interpolation weight model based on weighted collaborative filtering approach.
long_description: This function trains a interpolation weight model based on weighted collaborative filtering approach.

output_tables.name: WeightModelTable
output_tables.rDescription: Name for the output table containing the interpolation weights
output_tables.description: Name for the output table containing the interpolation weights

output_tables.name: BiasModelTable
output_tables.rDescription: Name for the output table containing the global, user, and item bias statistics.
output_tables.description: Name for the output table containing the global, user, and item bias statistics.

output_tables.name: NearestItemsTable
output_tables.rDescription: Name for the output table containing the nearest neighbors for each item. If this argument is not present, the NearestNeighbors table is not produced, If the argument is used, and a table with the specified name exists, the function uses the existing table to train the model, If the argument is used and no table with the specified name exists, the function creates a table with the specified name.
output_tables.description: Name for the output table containing the nearest neighbors for each item. If this argument is not present, the NearestNeighbors table is not produced, If the argument is used, and a table with the specified name exists, the function uses the existing table to train the model, If the argument is used and no table with the specified name exists, the function creates a table with the specified name.

argument_clauses.name: UserIdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The user id column in the rating table. The default is the first column in the rating table.
argument_clauses.description: The user id column in the rating table. The default is the first column in the rating table.

argument_clauses.name: ItemIdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The item id column in the rating table. The default is the second column in the rating table.
argument_clauses.description: The item id column in the rating table. The default is the second column in the rating table.

argument_clauses.name: RatingColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The rating column in the rating table. The default is the third column in the rating table.
argument_clauses.description: The rating column in the rating table. The default is the third column in the rating table.

argument_clauses.name: LearningRate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Initial learning rate. The learning rate adjusts automatically during training based on changes in the rmse. Default is 0.001.
argument_clauses.description: Initial learning rate. The learning rate adjusts automatically during training based on changes in the rmse. Default is 0.001.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Maximum number of iterations. Default is 10
argument_clauses.description: Maximum number of iterations. Default is 10

argument_clauses.name: K
argument_clauses.rDescription: The number of nearest neighbors used in the calculation of the interpolation weights. Default is 20.
argument_clauses.description: The number of nearest neighbors used in the calculation of the interpolation weights. Default is 20.

argument_clauses.name: StopThreshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: The function stops when the rmse drops below this level. Default is 0.0002.
argument_clauses.description: The function stops when the rmse drops below this level. Default is 0.0002.

argument_clauses.name: SimilarityMethod
argument_clauses.rDescription: The method used to calculate item similarity. The default is the Pearson correlation coefficient. Options include: Pearson (Pearson correlation coefficient), adjustedcosine (adjusted cosine similarity)
argument_clauses.description: The method used to calculate item similarity. The default is the Pearson correlation coefficient. Options include: Pearson (Pearson correlation coefficient), adjustedcosine (adjusted cosine similarity)

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
